intro: Wahlenbergia epacridea var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth wahlenbergia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. It has slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
